result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Lynn Chambers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No use  or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, for manufacturing, distribution or delivery.   Including no possession of sandwich baggies, no digital scales, etc.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, including ammunition or holster.
No possession of any cash in an amount greater than $150.00, including coins or bills.

Successfuly complete parenting class.
Defendant to comply with paying DOC supervision fees.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly compete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Court advised the defendat that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendatn could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Adjusting the confinement time would compromise the intent of the court and defeat  the purpose of the sentence, which was punishment, deterrence, and community protection - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Count three
Letter to defendant regarding DNA surcharges.
Letter from defendant regarding DNA surcharges.
United States Postal sticker: Return to Sender, Refused, Unable to Forward, received and filed.

Decision and Order Granting Request for Additional Sentence Credit, signed and filed. 
It is Hereby Ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a total of 198 days of sentence credit on counts two and three. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.

Defendant Timothy Lynn Chambers in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  .
AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 3, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 94 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 3: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 94 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or for the Substance Abuse Program. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION as to COUNT 2 and 3:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, for manufacturing, distribution, or delivery. Including no possession of sandwich baggies, no digital scales, etc. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons; including ammunition or holster.
- No possession of any cash in an amount greater than $150, including coins or bills. 
- Maintain full time work 
- Successfully complete parenting class. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Court prohibits contact with juvenile S.A. (D.O.B.8-29-96) during initial confinement and during Extended Supervision.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Timothy Lynn Chambers in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Timothy Lynn Chambers in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1, 4, 5, AND 6:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1,4,5 AND 6 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the REPEATER AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE ENHANCER dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2 (without the REPEATER and SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE ENHANCER) & COUNT 3:  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 10-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Timothy Lynn Chambers not in court, in custody.  Paul Hauer for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced from House of Correction.  Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial.  Case heard off the record.  Parties may have come to a resolution.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court orderes case adjourned for plea/sentencing in Branch 17.  Case remains scheduled for Jury trial on 09-29-2014 at 9:00 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Br. 17 down on 9-19-14, case rescheduled to 9-22-14, 8:30.  Parties notified.  alp

Attorney Klimetz informs court that defendant has retained Attorney Edward Wright.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.    Case is adjourned for status of counsel.   

SPEEDY DEMAND WITHDRAWN BY THE DEFENSE.  

Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.
